iti108:0.3: The Chapter on the Holy Offering of the Teaching
iti108:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti108:2.1: “Mendicants, those mendicants who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, frauds, insolent, and scattered: they are no mendicants of mine.
iti108:2.2: They’ve left this teaching and training, and they don’t achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
iti108:2.4: But those mendicants who are genuine, not flatterers, wise, amenable, and serene: they are mendicants of mine.
iti108:2.5: They haven’t left this teaching and training,
iti108:2.6: They’ve left this teaching and training, and they don’t achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
